definition.title: ƒê·ªãnh nghƒ©a
definition.content:

ƒê√¢y l√† th√¨ c∆° b·∫£n nh·∫•t trong ti·∫øng Anh, th∆∞·ªùng d√πng cho c√°c s·ª± vi·ªác x·∫£y ra ƒë·ªÅu ƒë·∫∑n.

structure.title: C·∫•u tr√∫c
structure.content:
**1. C·∫•u tr√∫c** v·ªõi {TO BE}[red]
·ªû th√¨ hi·ªán t·∫°i, ƒë·ªông t·ª´ "to be" c√≥ 3 d·∫°ng: **am/is/are** 

 *<color:yellow>A: Kh·∫≥ng ƒë·ªãnh</color>*

| Ch·ªß ng·ªØ | ƒê·ªông t·ª´ | V√≠ d·ª• |
|---------|---------|-------|
| I | am | I am a student. |
| He/She/It | is | She is happy. |
| You/We/They | are | They are friends. |

#### {B: Ph·ªß ƒë·ªãnh}[blue]

| Ch·ªß ng·ªØ | C·∫•u tr√∫c | V√≠ d·ª• |
|---------|----------|-------|
| I | am not | I am not tired. |
| He/She/It | is not (isn't) | He isn't here. |
| You/We/They | are not (aren't) | We aren't ready. |

#### {C: Nghi v·∫•n}[blue]

| C·∫•u tr√∫c | V√≠ d·ª• | Tr·∫£ l·ªùi |
|----------|-------|----------|
| Am + I...? | Am I late? | Yes, you are. / No, you aren't. |
| Is + he/she/it...? | Is she a teacher? | Yes, she is. / No, she isn't. |
| Are + you/we/they...? | Are they students? | Yes, they are. / No, they aren't. |

---

### 2. C·∫•u tr√∫c v·ªõi {ƒê·ªông t·ª´ th∆∞·ªùng}[yellow]

#### {A: Kh·∫≥ng ƒë·ªãnh}[blue]

**C√¥ng th·ª©c:** 
- I/You/We/They + {V (nguy√™n th·ªÉ)}[yellow]
- He/She/It + {V-s/es}[yellow]

| Ch·ªß ng·ªØ | ƒê·ªông t·ª´ | V√≠ d·ª• |
|---------|---------|-------|
| I/You/We/They | work | I work in Hanoi. |
| He/She/It | works | She works hard. |

**Quy t·∫Øc th√™m -s/-es:**

__L∆∞u √Ω quan tr·ªçng:__

- ƒê·ªông t·ª´ k·∫øt th√∫c b·∫±ng **-o, -ch, -sh, -x, -ss** ‚Üí th√™m **-es**
  - go ‚Üí goes
  - watch ‚Üí watches

- ƒê·ªông t·ª´ k·∫øt th√∫c b·∫±ng **ph·ª• √¢m + y** ‚Üí ƒë·ªïi **y ‚Üí ies**
  - study ‚Üí studies

- C√°c tr∆∞·ªùng h·ª£p c√≤n l·∫°i ‚Üí th√™m **-s**
  - work ‚Üí works

#### {B: Ph·ªß ƒë·ªãnh}[blue]

**C√¥ng th·ª©c:**
- I/You/We/They + {do not (don't)}[yellow] + V
- He/She/It + {does not (doesn't)}[yellow] + V

| Ch·ªß ng·ªØ | C·∫•u tr√∫c | V√≠ d·ª• |
|---------|----------|-------|
| I/You/We/They | don't + V | I don't like coffee. |
| He/She/It | doesn't + V | He doesn't play games. |

#### {C: Nghi v·∫•n}[blue]

**C√¥ng th·ª©c:**
- {Do}[yellow] + I/you/we/they + V?
- {Does}[yellow] + he/she/it + V?

| C·∫•u tr√∫c | V√≠ d·ª• | Tr·∫£ l·ªùi |
|----------|-------|----------|
| Do + you...? | Do you speak English? | Yes, I do. / No, I don't. |
| Does + he/she/it...? | Does she like music? | Yes, she does. / No, she doesn't. |
examples: I eat apples every day. (T√¥i ƒÉn t√°o m·ªói ng√†y.)
She eats lunch at 12 PM. (C√¥ ·∫•y ƒÉn tr∆∞a l√∫c 12 gi·ªù.)
They don't drink alcohol. (H·ªç kh√¥ng u·ªëng r∆∞·ª£u.)
Does he play football? (Anh ·∫•y c√≥ ch∆°i b√≥ng ƒë√° kh√¥ng?)

usage.title: C√°ch s·ª≠ d·ª•ng
usage.content:
Th√¨ hi·ªán t·∫°i ƒë∆°n ƒë∆∞·ª£c s·ª≠ d·ª•ng trong c√°c tr∆∞·ªùng h·ª£p sau:

### 1. {Th√≥i quen h√†ng ng√†y}[blue]

Di·ªÖn t·∫£ c√°c ho·∫°t ƒë·ªông l·∫∑p l·∫°i th∆∞·ªùng xuy√™n.

__V√≠ d·ª•:__
- I **wake up** at 6 AM every morning.
- She **drinks** coffee after breakfast.

### 2. {S·ª± th·∫≠t hi·ªÉn nhi√™n/Ch√¢n l√Ω}[blue]

C√°c s·ª± th·∫≠t kh√¥ng thay ƒë·ªïi.

__V√≠ d·ª•:__
- The Earth **revolves** around the Sun.
- Water **freezes** at 0¬∞C.

### 3. {L·ªãch tr√¨nh c·ªë ƒë·ªãnh}[blue]

C√°c s·ª± ki·ªán ƒë√£ ƒë∆∞·ª£c l√™n l·ªãch.

__V√≠ d·ª•:__
- The train **leaves** at 9 AM.

### 4. {S·ªü th√≠ch/C·∫£m x√∫c}[blue]

Di·ªÖn t·∫£ c·∫£m x√∫c, s·ªü th√≠ch l√¢u d√†i.

__V√≠ d·ª•:__
- I **love** chocolate.

examples: She works in London. (C√¥ ·∫•y l√†m vi·ªác ·ªü London.)

signs.title: D·∫•u hi·ªáu nh·∫≠n bi·∫øt
signs.content:
Th√¨ hi·ªán t·∫°i ƒë∆°n th∆∞·ªùng ƒëi k√®m v·ªõi c√°c **tr·∫°ng t·ª´ t·∫ßn su·∫•t** v√† **c·ª•m t·ª´ ch·ªâ th·ªùi gian**:

### {Tr·∫°ng t·ª´ t·∫ßn su·∫•t}[yellow]

| Tr·∫°ng t·ª´ | Nghƒ©a | V·ªã tr√≠ trong c√¢u |
|----------|-------|------------------|
| always | lu√¥n lu√¥n (100%) | Tr∆∞·ªõc ƒë·ªông t·ª´ th∆∞·ªùng, sau "to be" |
| usually | th∆∞·ªùng xuy√™n (80%) | Tr∆∞·ªõc ƒë·ªông t·ª´ th∆∞·ªùng, sau "to be" |
| often | th∆∞·ªùng (60%) | Tr∆∞·ªõc ƒë·ªông t·ª´ th∆∞·ªùng, sau "to be" |
| sometimes | th·ªânh tho·∫£ng (40%) | ƒê·∫ßu c√¢u, gi·ªØa c√¢u, cu·ªëi c√¢u |
| seldom/rarely | hi·∫øm khi (20%) | Tr∆∞·ªõc ƒë·ªông t·ª´ th∆∞·ªùng, sau "to be" |
| never | kh√¥ng bao gi·ªù (0%) | Tr∆∞·ªõc ƒë·ªông t·ª´ th∆∞·ªùng, sau "to be" |

### {C·ª•m t·ª´ ch·ªâ th·ªùi gian}[yellow]
- **every** day/week/month/year
- **once/twice** a week/month
- **on** Mondays/weekends
- **in the morning/afternoon/evening**
- **at night**

**L∆∞u √Ω v·ªã tr√≠:**
- Tr·∫°ng t·ª´ t·∫ßn su·∫•t: **tr∆∞·ªõc ƒë·ªông t·ª´ th∆∞·ªùng**, **sau "to be"**
  - I {always}[yellow] drink milk. ‚úì
  - She is {always}[yellow] busy. ‚úì
- C·ª•m t·ª´ th·ªùi gian: th∆∞·ªùng ·ªü **cu·ªëi c√¢u** ho·∫∑c **ƒë·∫ßu c√¢u**
  - I go to school {every day}[yellow]. ‚úì
  - {Every morning}[yellow], he reads newspapers. ‚úì
examples: I always drink coffee in the morning. (T√¥i lu√¥n u·ªëng c√† ph√™ v√†o bu·ªïi s√°ng.)
He never smokes. (Anh ·∫•y kh√¥ng bao gi·ªù h√∫t thu·ªëc.)
She goes to the gym twice a week. (C√¥ ·∫•y ƒë·∫øn ph√≤ng gym hai l·∫ßn m·ªôt tu·∫ßn.)
We usually have dinner at 7 PM. (Ch√∫ng t√¥i th∆∞·ªùng ƒÉn t·ªëi l√∫c 7 gi·ªù t·ªëi.)

rules.title: C√°c quy t·∫Øc quan tr·ªçng
rules.content:
### 1. {Quy t·∫Øc th√™m -s/-es v·ªõi ƒë·ªông t·ª´}[blue]

| Tr∆∞·ªùng h·ª£p | Quy t·∫Øc | V√≠ d·ª• |
|------------|---------|-------|
| K·∫øt th√∫c b·∫±ng -o, -ch, -sh, -ss, -x, -z | Th√™m **-es** | go ‚Üí goes, watch ‚Üí watches, wash ‚Üí washes |
| K·∫øt th√∫c b·∫±ng ph·ª• √¢m + y | ƒê·ªïi **y ‚Üí ies** | study ‚Üí studies, cry ‚Üí cries |
| K·∫øt th√∫c b·∫±ng nguy√™n √¢m + y | Th√™m **-s** | play ‚Üí plays, say ‚Üí says |
| C√°c tr∆∞·ªùng h·ª£p c√≤n l·∫°i | Th√™m **-s** | work ‚Üí works, like ‚Üí likes |

### 2. {ƒê·ªông t·ª´ "to be" ƒë·∫∑c bi·ªát}[blue]

Kh√¥ng s·ª≠ d·ª•ng **do/does** v·ªõi ƒë·ªông t·ª´ "to be":
- ‚úì She **is** a teacher.
- ‚úó She **does is** a teacher.
- ‚úì **Is** he happy?
- ‚úó **Does** he **is** happy?

### 3. {ƒê·ªông t·ª´ "have" ƒë·∫∑c bi·ªát}[blue]

| Ch·ªß ng·ªØ | D·∫°ng ƒë√∫ng | V√≠ d·ª• |
|---------|-----------|-------|
| I/You/We/They | have | I have a car. |
| He/She/It | has | She has two cats. |

### 4. {L·ªói th∆∞·ªùng g·∫∑p}[red]

^^Tr√°nh nh·ªØng l·ªói sau:^^

‚ùå **SAI:** He don't like pizza.

‚úÖ **ƒê√öNG:** He doesn't like pizza.

---

‚ùå **SAI:** Does she likes coffee?

‚úÖ **ƒê√öNG:** Does she like coffee?

---

‚ùå **SAI:** They is students.

‚úÖ **ƒê√öNG:** They are students.

---

‚ùå **SAI:** I am go to school.

‚úÖ **ƒê√öNG:** I go to school.
